discussion.content: What is Pester lol, Microsoft doesnt support converting the profiles according to their own docs

Microsoft does not support migrating profiles from User Profile Disks (UPD) or Roaming User Profiles (RUP) to FSLogix.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cloud-adoption-framework/migrate/azure-best-practices/contoso-migration-rds-to-azure-virtual-desktop#step-4-prepare-users-for-new-profiles-using-fslogix

questions.question_text:
You need to ensure the resiliency of the user profiles for the Boston office users. The solution must meet the user performance requirements.
What should you do?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Why not "Modify the replication settings of storage1"? Storage1 is general purpose v1, Locally-redundant storage account and in "User Profile Requirements" there is: 
- Ensure that the user profiles for the Boston office users replicate synchronously between two Azure regions.
Changing LRS to GRS should fulfill requirements

Selected Answer: D
Passed with a 919 on 02/29/2024. This question was on the test.

Selected Answer: D
the question is associated with performance requirements but it has to do with user profile requirements, I agree with D.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct answer.

Azure Files supports cross-region asynchronous replication that you can specify when you create the storage account. If the asynchronous nature of Azure Files already covers your disaster recovery goals, then you don't need to do additional configuration.

If you need synchronous replication to minimize data loss, then we recommend you use FSLogix Cloud Cache instead.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-gb/learn/modules/plan-implement-business-continuity-disaster-recovery/4-fslogix-configuration
Correct

choices.A: Modify the Account kind setting of storage1.
choices.B: Modify the replication settings of storage1.

choices.A: an Azure Virtual Desktop automation task

questions.question_text:
You need to configure the virtual machines that have the Pool1 prefix. The solution must meet the technical requirements.
What should you use?

discussion.content: Azure Automation is the correct answer

Selected Answer: D
Answer D is correct. Ensure that Pool1 virtual machines only run during business hours.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

D (Azure Automation) is not correct because it is a general-purpose tool that requires additional setup and is not specific to Azure Virtual Desktop.

A (Azure Virtual Desktop automation task) is correct because it is specifically designed for managing and automating tasks within Azure Virtual Desktop host pools, making it the most efficient and straightforward solution.
Answer is D because the requirement for Pool1 is "Ensure that the Pool1 virtual machines only run during business hours." This can only be completed with Azure Automation.

Selected Answer: D
D is right.

Selected Answer: D
D is right Answer

Selected Answer: D
I was wrong correct answer is D. 

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/automation/automation-solution-vm-management-config#schedule
"This scenario is the default configuration when you first deploy Start/Stop VMs during off-hours. For example, you can configure the feature to stop all VMs across a subscription when you leave work in the evening, and start them in the morning when you are back in the office."

Selected Answer: D
D is correct answer.

A is not a valid solution for VM's.
B would only shutdown VMs outside working hours but not restart them. 
C does nothing other than show service health.

Selected Answer: A
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/logic-apps/create-automation-tasks-azure-resources

A is correct Answer, this can be done via D but more A is simpler approach. B is wrong as you cannot turn on the VM, you can only shutdown VM.

Selected Answer: B
B. Virtual machine auto-shutdown

Technical requirements has the following sentence: Ensure that the Pool1 virtual machines only run during business hours.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/automation/automation-solution-vm-management-config#schedule
"This scenario is the default configuration when you first deploy Start/Stop VMs during off-hours. For example, you can configure the feature to stop all VMs across a subscription when you leave work in the evening, and start them in the morning when you are back in the office."
